figura.docs.globals.extura: The Extura object that contains some random stuff. Only visible if it's enabled in the settings.
figura.docs.globals.add_script:
(Extura) Allows you to add, edit or remove scripts from your avatar.
Accepts 2 strings, if the second string is nil, the script is unloaded. Note this will NOT remove events
figura.docs.globals.get_scripts: (Extura) Returns a table of script names.
figura.docs.globals.get_script: (Extura) Returns the contents of a script or nil if the script doesn't exist.
figura.config.use_secure_cloud.tooltip: Whether to use a Secure Connection for the cloud
figura.docs.world.get_spawn_point: (Extura) Returns a vector with the coordinates of the world spawn
figura.docs.world.isChunkLoaded: (Extura) Returns whether a chunk is loaded at the given block position
figura.docs.world.get_nearby_entities: (Extura) Returns entities near the given block position
figura.docs.world.raycast_entity: (Extura > linetraceEntity) Returns the entity and pos of a linetrace.
figura.docs.world.raycast_block: (Extura > linetraceBlock) Returns the block, side, and pos of a linetrace
figura.docs.world.linetraceBlock: (Extura) Returns the block, side, and pos of a linetrace
figura.docs.world.linetraceEntity: (Extura) Returns the entity and pos of a linetrace
figura.config.dangerous: Extura - DANGEROUS | ALLOWS AVATARS TO DO DANGEROUS THINGS | EXTURA IS NOT RESPONSIBLE FOR DAMAGE CAUSED BY USING THIS!
figura.config.helper_errors.tooltip: Enables the game throwing errors for extra things to help preventing confusing errors later
figura.config.expose_extura_api.tooltip: Expose the Extura API to *ALL* Figura avatars
figura.config.expose_java_api.tooltip: Expose the Java API to *YOUR* Figura avatar.
figura.config.expose_sensitive_libraries: Exposes io, os, debug and extura.getHttp to *YOUR* Figura avatar. If you do not know what this means DO NOT ENABLE THIS. This will allow any equipped avatars to run ANY program on your computer and edit ANY file on your computer
figura.config.get_blocks_limit.tooltip: Toggles if scripts can bypass the 8 block limit of world.getBlocks
figura.config.get_target_limit.tooltip: Toggles if scripts can bypass the 20 block limit of entity.getTargetedBlock and entity.getTargetedEntity
figura.config.use_global_scripts.tooltip: Toggles if scripts are loaded from the `global_scripts` directory in your Figura folder. Note that they can override normal scripts if they have the same path/name
figura.config.use_mc_host_resolver.toolt: Toggles if Minecraft's host resolver is used. Normal Figura uses this. Disabling this will allow ports and subdirs to be used
figura.docs.avatar.set_nbt:
(Extura) Set nbt of object at the path
* First argument is the path, if a name contains a dot, use '\\.'
* Second argument is the object to replace with
* Third argument is the type, use this if you need a specific type
Valid types are: float, int, short, double, string, bool, boolean, bytearray, null, nil
figura.docs.avatar.get_size_limit: (Extura) Get the size limit of the avatar from the backend
figura.docs.host.allow_extura_cheats:
(Extura) Returns whether functions like host:setVelocity will work.
 Returns true if on a local server, permission level is above 2 or player has an objective named 'extura_can_cheat'
figura.docs.host.upload_avatar: (Extura) Uploads your current avatar to the backend and then reloads it
figura.docs.host.reload_avatar: (Extura) Reloads the avatar of the entity UUID provided. If no UUID is provided then it'll reload your avatar
figura.docs.host.load_local_avatar: (Extura) Loads the avatar from the specified path. If no path is provided, current avatar is unloaded.
figura.docs.host.set_player_movement: (Extura) Set if the player can move normally
figura.docs.host.get_player_movement: (Extura) Get if the player can move normally
figura.docs.host.drop_item: (Extura - Requires host.allowExturaCheats() to be true) Drops the player's item
figura.docs.host.start_riding:
(Extura - Requires host.allowExturaCheats() to be true) Force the player to ride a vehicle
* First argument is the entity to ride, if nil is provided then player will dismount instead
figura.docs.host.override_player_movemen:
(Extura) Lock a specific input to a state,
* first argument is the input('up', 'down', 'left', 'right', 'jump', or 'shift')
* second argument is the state, true, false or nil to unlock
figura.docs.host.set_velocity: (Extura - Requires host.allowExturaCheats() to be true) Sets the player's velocity
figura.docs.host.set_position: (Extura - Requires host.allowExturaCheats() to be true) Sets the player's position
figura.docs.host.set_natural_forces: (Extura - Requires host.allowExturaCheats() to be true) Sets if the player is effected by gravity and drag
figura.docs.host.set_gravity: (Extura - Requires host.allowExturaCheats() to be true) Sets if the player is effected by gravity
figura.docs.host.set_shader_pack_name: (Extura) Sets the currently selected shader pack, an empty value will select the internal shader
figura.docs.host.first_person_model_set_: (Extura) Sets whether First Person Model is currently enabled
figura.docs.client.get_mod_version: (Extura) Get the Version of a mod as a string. Returns an null if mod isn't loaded
figura.docs.client.get_mod_name: (Extura) Gets the name of a mod as a string. Returns an empty string if the mod isn't loaded
figura.docs.client.get_uuid_from_player: (Extura) Returns the UUID of a player from their name
figura.docs.client.ping_rate_limit: (Extura) Returns the amount of pings you can send in a second
figura.docs.client.ping_size_limit: (Extura) Returns the max size of a ping
figura.docs.client.is_backend_connected: (Extura) Returns true if using backend is connected.
figura.docs.client.get_current_backend: (Extura) Returns the current IP being used for the backend, or an empty string if not connected at all.
figura.docs.client.first_person_model_en: (Extura) (DEPRECATED) Gets whether First Person Model is currently enabled
figura.docs.client.first_person_model_is: (Extura) (DEPRECATED) Gets whether First Person Model is currently rendering - only useful in a RENDER event
figura.docs.client.regex_find: (Extura) Checks a string against a (Java flavor) Regular Expression and returns true if any matches are found
figura.docs.client.regex_match: (Extura) Matches a string against a (Java flavor) Regular Expression and returns all matches
figura.docs.client.regex_replace: (Extura) Matches a string against a (Java flavor) Regular Expression and replaces all matches with a specified string
figura.docs.player.get_destroy_speed: (Extura) Returns the player's destroy speed for a specific block
figura.docs.player.has_correct_tool_for_: (Extura) Returns if the player's tool can get drops from a specific block
figura.docs.player.can_harm_player: (Extura) Returns if the player can be harmed by the passed in player
figura.docs.player.is_using_spy_glass: (Extura) Returns if the player is using a spy glass
figura.docs.player.get_projectile: (Extura) Returns the player's current projectile for the passed in item
figura.docs.player.get_latency: (Extura) Returns the player's latency. Returns -1 if unable to get latency
figura.docs.player.get_tablist_display_n: (Extura) Returns the player's display name on the tab list
figura.docs.player.get_nameplate:
(Extura) Returns the player's nameplate text if they have one, otherwise returns null.
 First argument should be the nameplate type(LIST, CHAT, ENTITY)
figura.docs.living_entity.get_nameplate:
(Extura) Returns the entity's nameplate text if they have one, otherwise returns null.
 First argument should be the nameplate type(LIST, CHAT, ENTITY)
figura.permissions.value.printing.toolti: Allows this avatar to print to chat if Log Others is enabled
figura.docs.extura.get_figura_setting: Grabs a Figura setting and returns the value of it
figura.docs.extura.async_lua_function: Runs specified lua function in a thread. NOTE: VERY UNSTABLE!
figura.docs.extura.httpGet: Makes an http request to a url
figura.docs.events.processs_script: The PROCESS_SCRIPT event is run whenever a script is required and a preprocessor is loaded. The script's name and contents are passed as arguments, the script's contents will be replaced with the return value
figura.badges.no_permissions.extura_chea: Tried to use Extura's cheating options without OP!
figura.docs.entity.get_curio:
(Extura) Gets an ItemStack for the item in the given Curios slot type
Optionally accepts a slot ID, indexed at 0
player.get_xp_for_next_level: (Extura) Gets the amount of experience needed to level up
figura.docs.world.get_map_data:
Takes a string, e.g., `map_3`, and returns a table of data if the map exists.
Map data may be unsynced, and will only update when holding the map
